whats a title for this talk

Nearly 80% of the population will have a smartphone, and they are rapidly integrating with large language models. What unseen values are baked into the LLMs during training, particularly during Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback(RLHF)? LLMs are designed to give answers rather than inspire thinking, and during our workshops with youth in SWANA, we find an overreliance and trust in LLMs, resulting in poor results and limited learning and development.
LLMs are designed to deliver results with values baked in at many levels. Our question is how to leverage this novel technology to bring about self-authorship, personal growth, and contribution. In short, how do LLMs help people in their becoming as opposed to helping people in their doing? We believe that one of the greatest tools of accessible education technology to support becoming can be delivered en-mass if only LLMs had different values embedded. 

What are the current values? What should those values be? Where are our leverage points? 

This workshop will attempt to articulate a starting point for these questions, and will support the formation of a few clusters to begin an answer.


During the workshop, we will collaborate to learn and discover intervention methods to aid marginalized youth and those with limited learning opportunities. We'll explore three intervention channels to identify different scales and complexity of influence mechanisms.

Simple / minimal impact: 
System prompts / LLM interface design. 
What system prompts can promote learning and support marginalized youth in their development?

Medium complexity / medium impact: 
Open Source LLM / Fine Tuning
What methods of fine-tuning are possible? Which opensource tool kits can we use, what are the available datasets, or which datasets can we create with LLMs to fine-tune an LLM to support marginalized youth's development?

More complex, largest impact:
How can the workshop group influence OpenAI, Claude, and Perplexity Gemini to make changes to their RLHF protocols? Can we work together to research and create a white paper on modified RLHF personas and objectives? What should the goals of the LLMs be?


We aim to continue the conversation and encourage those who want to participate in supporting us in writing a white paper on a modified RHLF approach and a policy paper addressing the question of the value embedded in LLMs. 
We aim to develop a framework for assessing LLMs along the values, becoming vs doing, and developmental axes. 
Finally, we hope to contribute to a GitHub project containing lists of system prompts attempting to prototype the "mindset" the LLMs of the future may enhance that make learning and growing accessible to all people with a smartphone.

### Title Suggestions for the Talk:

1. **"Empowering Youth Through Ethical AI: Rethinking LLM Values for Personal Growth"**
2. **"From Doing to Becoming: Redefining LLM Values for Holistic Development"**
3. **"Unlocking Potential: Leveraging LLMs for Self-Authorship and Personal Growth"**
4. **"Shifting the Paradigm: Integrating Ethical Values in LLMs for Youth Development"**
5. **"Beyond Answers: Cultivating Critical Thinking and Growth through AI"**
6. **"AI for Growth: Embedding Values in LLMs to Foster Self-Authorship in Youth"**
7. **"Inspiring Minds: Redesigning LLMs for Educational Equity and Personal Development"**
8. **"Rethinking AI: Promoting Self-Authorship and Development through LLMs"**
9. **"AI in Education: Shaping Future Values for Holistic Youth Development"**
10. **"Reimagining LLMs: Values for Self-Authorship and Inclusive Growth"**
